contents: The chemical reactions in the battery (2) <u>is causing</u> electrons to build up at one end of the battery—the anode, or negative terminal. Because the two ends of the battery become unbalanced (with more electrons at one end), electrons try to flow from one end to the other to create balance. (3) <u>Anyhow,</u> the electrolyte in the center of the battery stops electrons from moving through the battery. When no circuit is connected to the battery, the extra electrons have nowhere to go.
